docs.title: youtube-to-docs
docs.text:
Convert YouTube videos to docs/sheets for discoverability.

See the CLI by running:

uvx youtube-to-docs --help

Created with the help of AI. All artifacts have been checked and work as expected.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.14 or higher
  • uv (recommended) or pip

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Install dependencies: 

    uv pip install -r requirements.txt
# OR
pip install -r requirements.txt

  2. Install the package in editable mode (optional, but recommended for development): 

    uv pip install -e .

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
To run the script locally using the entry point defined in pyproject.toml:

uv run youtube-to-docs --model gemini-3-flash-preview

Alternatively, you can run it as a module:

uv run python -m youtube_to_docs.main --model gemini-3-flash-preview

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text: We use pytest for testing.

docs.title: Using uv (Recommended)
docs.text:
To run tests with all dependencies automatically handled:

uv run --group test pytest

docs.title: Cleanup
docs.text:
To delete the generated CSV file and transcript/summary directories:

Remove-Item -Path "youtube-docs.csv", "transcript-files", "summary-files" -Recurse -Force -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
• main.py: Main application script.
  • tests/: Directory containing test files.
  • requirements.txt: Python package dependencies.

docs.title: Tooling
docs.text:
This project uses modern Python tooling for code quality:

  • Ruff: For linting and code formatting.
  • Ty: For static type checking.

These tools are configured in pyproject.toml.

docs.title: Running Ruff
docs.text:
To check for linting errors:

uv tool run ruff check .

To fix fixable linting errors automatically:

uv tool run ruff check --fix .

To format the code:

uv tool run ruff format .

docs.title: Running Ty (Type Checking)
docs.text:
To run type checks:

uv tool run ty check

docs.title: Pre-commit
docs.text:
To run pre-commit hook:

uv tool run pre-commit run --all-files

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text: We use MkDocs with the Material theme for documentation.

docs.title: Build and Serve Locally
docs.text:
To preview the documentation locally:

uv run mkdocs serve

This will start a local server, usually at http://127.0.0.1:8000.

To build the static site (output will be in the site/ directory):

uv run mkdocs build

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text:
The documentation is automatically built and deployed to GitHub Pages on every push to the main branch via GitHub Actions.

If you need to deploy manually:

uv run mkdocs gh-deploy

docs.title: Release to PyPI
docs.text:
To publish a new version of the package to PyPI, follow these steps:

  1. Build the package: This will create a dist/ directory with the distribution files. 

    uv tool run --from build pyproject-build

  2. Upload to PyPI: Use twine to upload the distribution files.

    If your .pypirc is already configured with your API key: 

    uv tool run twine upload dist/*

docs.title: Quick Deploy (One-liner)
docs.text:
To build and deploy in one command (requires .pypirc configuration): 

Remove-Item -Recurse -Force dist; uv tool run --from build pyproject-build; uv tool run twine upload dist/*

docs.title: Continuous Deployment
docs.text:
A manual GitHub Action is available to automate this process.

  1. Ensure you have a PYPI_API_TOKEN secret configured in your repository settings.
  2. Go to the "Actions" tab in your repository.
  3. Select the "PyPI Publish" workflow.
  4. Click "Run workflow".

docs.title: YouTube Automatic Captions
docs.text:
This tool relies on YouTube's captioning system. Please note that: - Availability: Automatic captions are generated using speech recognition technology and may not be immediately available after upload. - Accuracy: While improving, captions may misrepresent spoken content due to accents, dialects, or background noise. - Languages: Support varies across numerous languages. - Troubleshooting: Captions may not generate for long videos, poor audio quality, or multiple overlapping speakers.

For more details, see the official YouTube Help: Use automatic captioning.
